On 10.11.2010 05:50, William Martinez Pomares wrote:
> Again, HTTP semantics are not at all an easy mapping to CRUD, are they?
>
> The hypermedia control you mention is an interesting example.
> Let's say Creation.
> PUT for creation has been somehow banned, as it implies the client
> forces the URI into the server. Anyhow, that is how it works. The Server
> should own its name space, so issuing a PUT with a URI defined by the
> client makes no sense, right?

Wrong. It depends on the application.

> ...

Best regards, Julian
